page.title: 12THE CROSS KEYS
page.content:
This is a 17th. Century inn at Upwood. The landlord, Mr. McQueen, has worked there for about 26 years. Part of it used to be a butcher's shop. The oldest part of the building is a long, black beam attached to the ceiling. There is a hook on the ceiling to hang up a lantern during a blackout. On one of the fire-places there is a special brick to commemorate Lady Diana's wedding day in 1981. The bar is the newest part of the inn. The inn was built about 300 years ago. The landlord thinks that when Upwood Church was being built they also made a wooden building for the workmen to live in. That building, although it has undergone several changes, is now the inn that we have today.
by Lucy and Bronwyn
